metadata.topic: Topic 12: Patterns in the Chemical World

topics: Topic 12: Patterns in the Chemical World
questions.question: Which of the following oxides would form an acidic solution when added to water

options.content: carbon dioxide
silicon dioxide
aluminium oxide
lithium oxide

topics: Topic 12: Patterns in the Chemical World
questions.question: Which of the following is NOT a characteristic property of transition metals?

options.content: They form coloured compounds
They exhibit variable oxidation numbers in their compounds
They react with dilute hydrochloric acid to give hydrogen gas
They exhibit catalytic property in elemental state or as compounds

topics: Topic 12: Patterns in the Chemical World
questions.question: 1st statement Both aluminium oxide and magnesium oxide exhibit similar acid-base properties 2nd statement Both aluminium oxide and magnesium oxide are ionic oxides

options.content: Both statements are true and the 2nd statement is a correct explanation of the 1st statement
Both statements are true but the 2nd statement is NOT a correct explanation of the 1st statement
The 1st statement is false but the 2nd statement is true
Both statements are false

topics: Topic 12: Patterns in the Chemical World
questions.question: Which of the following graphs (not drawn to scale) correctly shows the variation in electrical conductivity of the elements in the third period of the Periodic Table at room temperature?

topics: Topic 12: Patterns in the Chemical World
questions.question: 1st statement Aluminium oxide is soluble in water 2nd statement Aluminium oxide is an amphoteric oxide

options.content: Both statements are true and the 2nd statement is a correct explanation of the 1st statement
Both statements are true but the 2nd statement is NOT a correct explanation of the 1st statement
The 1st statement is false but the 2nd statement is true
Both statements are false

topics: Topic 12: Patterns in the Chemical World
questions.question: Which of the following statements concerning the Periodic Table is correct?

options.content: The melting point of the Group I elements increases down the group
The boiling point of the Group VII elements increases down the group
The elements are arranged in the order of increasing relative atomic mass
The electrical conductivity of the third period elements increases from left to right

topics: Topic 12: Patterns in the Chemical World
questions.question: 1st statement The melting point of silicon is higher than that of aluminium 2nd statement The number of electrons in a silicon atom is greater than that in an aluminium atom

options.content: Both statements are true and the 2nd statement is a correct explanation of the 1st statement
Both statements are true but the 2nd statement is NOT a correct explanation of the 1st statement
The 1st statement is false but the 2nd statement is true
Both statements are false

topics: Topic 12: Patterns in the Chemical World
questions.question: Which of the following trends involving Na, Mg and Al is INCORRECT?

options.content: Melting point of metal:		Al > Mg > Na
Electronegativity of metal:		Al > Mg > Na
Metal reactivity with water:		Na > Mg > Al
Base strength of metal oxide:	Al<sub>2</sub>O<sub>3</sub> > MgO > Na2O

topics: Topic 12: Patterns in the Chemical World
questions.question: 1st statement P4O10(s) can react with NaOH(aq) 2nd statement P4O10(s) is an acidic oxide

options.content: Both statements are true and the 2nd statement is a correct explanation of the 1st statement
Both statements are true but the 2nd statement is NOT a correct explanation of the 1st statement
The 1st statement is false but the 2nd statement is true
Both statements are false

questions.question: Which of the following graphs (not drawn to scale) shows the variation in melting points of the elements in the third period of the Periodic Table?

topics: Topic 12: Patterns in the Chemical World
questions.question: Which of the following statements concerning silicon dioxide solid is correct?

options.content: There are single covalent bonds between silicon atoms and oxygen atoms
It is insoluble in sodium hydroxide solution
It has a simple molecular structure
It conducts electricity at room temperature

topics: Topic 12: Patterns in the Chemical World
questions.question: Which of the following statements is correct?

options.content: The boiling point of argon is lower than that of neon
The boiling point of nitrogen is lower than that of oxygen
The melting point of silicon is lower than that of sodium
The melting point of aluminium is lower than that of magnesium

topics: Topic 12: Patterns in the Chemical World
questions.question:
Which of the following processes can illustrate the characteristics of transition metals?
(1) mixing AgNO<sub>3</sub>(aq) and NaCl(aq)
(2) mixing FeSO<sub>4</sub>(aq) and Br<sub>2</sub>(aq)
(3) mixing CuSO<sub>4</sub>(aq) and H<sub>2</sub>O(l)

options.content: (1) only
(2) only
(1) and (3) only
(2) and (3) only

topics: Topic 12: Patterns in the Chemical World
questions.question: Which of the following does NOT exhibit a characteristic of iron as a transition metal?

options.content: Iron corrodes readily
Iron can be used as a catalyst
Iron can form two chlorides
Iron(II) sulphate solution is green

topics: Topic 12: Patterns in the Chemical World
questions.question: Which of the following statements concerning the oxides of elements in the third period of the Periodic Table is correct?

options.content: SiO<sub></sub>2(s) dissolves in water to form a neutral solution
P<sub>4</sub>O<sub>10</sub>(s) dissolves in water to form an acidic solution
Al<sub>2</sub>O<sub>3</sub>(s) dissolves in water to form an alkaline solution
Cl<sub>2</sub>O(g) dissolves in water to form Cl<sub>2</sub>(aq) and O<sub>2</sub>(g) only

topics: Topic 12: Patterns in the Chemical World
questions.question:
The sketch below shows the melting points of ten consecutive elements in the second and third periods of the Periodic Table, arranged in the order of increasing atomic numbers. Sodium is one of these ten elements. Which of W, X, Y or Z may represent sodium?

![](images/Topic12/dse2020-30-1766670526584-inline-q-qimg-1766670523683-8753-mjli1obo-8972.png)

options.content: W
X
Y
Z

topics: Topic 12: Patterns in the Chemical World
questions.question: Which of the following statements correctly describes the property of an amphoteric oxide?

options.content: It can react as an acid or as a base
It can react with water to form an acid and an alkali
It can be simultaneously oxidised and reduced in a reaction
It can react with water to form an oxidising agent and a reducing agent

topics: Topic 12: Patterns in the Chemical World
questions.question:
Which of the following statements concerning the elements in the third period of the Periodic Table going from Na to Cl is/are correct?
(1) The bond type of the elements changes from metallic bonding to covalent bonding
(2) The oxide of the elements changes from acidic to basic
(3) The electrical conductivity of the elements keeps decreasing

options.content: (1) only
(2) only
(1) and (3) only
(2) and (3) only
